text: Ypsolopha lutisplendida is a moth of the family Ypsolophidae. It is known from north-western China. The length of the forewings is 9.6–10.7 mm. The larvae feed on the pine tree Pinus tabulaeformis. ==Etymology== The specific name lutisplendida is derived from the Latin luteus (meaning yellow) and splendidus (meaning shining), in concordance with the yellowish glittering of the forewings. ==References== Category:Ypsolophidae Category:Moths of China
title: Ypsolopha lutisplendida
